meanings.definition: Capable of being imagined or understood.
meanings.sent1: It is conceivable to picture a world with flying cars.
meanings.sent2: The concept of time travel is conceivable in science fiction.
meanings.sent3: It's conceivable that aliens would find our human behavior amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared to heights inconceivable to most.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks were so conceivable, they left the audience in awe.

meanings.sent1: In this story, a talking animal is conceivable.
meanings.sent2: The idea of parallel universes is conceivable in theoretical physics.
meanings.sent3: It's conceivable that a cat would dream of ruling the world.
meanings.sent4: His success was conceivable only in his wildest dreams.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was so conceivable, it brought tears to her eyes.
